title: Chapter 192
content: # Chapter 192 Grid stared at the blueprint, his jaw clenched. *The more I look at this thing, the more it pisses me off.* He had to admit it. Mumud's Orb was a masterpiece. The magic possession system alone was revolutionary, but the reduced cooldowns? The faster casting speeds? It made his mouth water. But the magic damage coefficient was... ordinary. Not bad. Just ordinary. *Why?* Grid's eyes narrowed as he traced the numbers again. Then it clicked. *Balance. They nerfed the damage on purpose.* If the orb had peaked stats across the board, the usage requirements would spike through the roof. No one could equip it. A perfect weapon you couldn't use was just expensive trash. His pulse quickened. *This is it. This is what I've been missing.* Failure flashed through his mind. That beautiful, stupid, useless shark-shaped greatsword gathering dust in his inventory. Pure offense. Zero compromise. **5,000 Strength**. **Advanced Sword Mastery Level 8**. Requirements so absurd that Grid himself couldn't use it. *Two years.* That's how long the analysts predicted before any player hit **5,000 Strength**. Two years of the strongest weapon in Satisfy sitting in his inventory like a participation trophy. He'd named it Failure for a reason. *If I'd just... lowered the attack power. Made it balanced like this orb.* Lower requirements. Actually usable. Sellable. *I'd be swimming in gold right now.* His hands trembled slightly. The revelation felt like a physical weight lifting from his shoulders. This was it. This was how you made *practical* legendary items. Not just stat-stick abominations. Grid exhaled slowly, a rare smile creeping across his face. *I can fix the Mass-produced One-handed Sword with this. Lower the ceiling, raise the floor.* He pulled up the material list for Mumud's Orb. Abyss Mithril. Frost Queen's Breath. Water Clan King's Tears. *What the hell are these?* His cursor hovered over each item. The descriptions loaded. The smile died. > **[Frost Queen's Breath]** > > The extremely low temperature climate of Heraris caused the Frost Queen's breath to crystallize. This crystal will never melt and has the effect of amplifying magic power. > > **Weight:** 0.1 > **[Abyss Mithril]** > > Deep in the ocean. A rare mineral that is only found near the Siren Kingdom. Its harmony with magic power is three times better than normal mithril. > > **Weight:** 15 > **[Water Clan King's Tears]** > > The Siren King sheds tears every five months, longing for his daughter who left the world before him. These tears have the mysterious function of imbuing items with magic. > > **Weight:** 0.1 Grid's stomach dropped. *Siren Kingdom.* Then the gears started turning. *The tears. That's the secret.* If he designed items around the Water Clan King's Tears as a core material, he could create magic possession weapons. Real ones. Not this half-baked elemental nonsense. *What if I put S-grade magic on my armor?* Counter Barrier soaking hits while he waded into melee. Meteor raining from his sword with every swing. He wouldn't just be strong. *I'd be a one-man army.* Hell Gao flashed through his mind. That burning bastard who'd killed him twice. With magic possession items? *I could solo him.* His thoughts spiraled. *And the pavranium...* The golden discs. The needles. All of them capable of flight, autonomous defense, and now—if he cracked this—autonomous *offense*. Meteor from seven different angles. Lightning needles. Fire blade bombardment. *True Overgeared.* Grid's grin stretched wide. *I'm a damn genius.* For thirty glorious seconds, he basked in his own brilliance. Then reality returned with the force of a sledgehammer. *How did Euphemina get this stuff?* His eyes locked on the description again. "Only found near the Siren Kingdom." "Siren King sheds tears every five months." *First discoverer of the Siren Kingdom.* Euphemina. "Kuoh..." The sound escaped before he could stop it. A low, strangled groan. His stomach cramped. *How much did she make?* First discoverer benefits were legendary. Quests. Titles. Exclusive access to rare materials. And Siren was an entire *kingdom*. *That lucky...* His jaw worked silently. She'd handed him this production method out of charity. Gratitude. Friendship. And Grid had been moved. Genuinely moved. *I wanted to make her something amazing.* The affinity was real now. He didn't flinch when she smiled anymore. Didn't feel that gnawing suspicion. *But she doesn't need my help.* Euphemina had the Duplicator class. Hidden. Overpowered. And now she'd stumbled into the *Siren Kingdom* like some protagonist out of a fairy tale. Grid's hands hovered over the materials. *Wouldn't it be educational to let her experience failure for once?* The thought wormed in like poison. He knew it was petty. Knew it was small. But human nature didn't rewrite itself overnight. Despite everything, despite his growth, Grid was still the guy who argued with strangers on forums at 2 AM. *Just... a rare rating. That's still decent.* He grabbed the Abyss Mithril and shoved it into the furnace. The bellows hissed as he pumped air through the coals. Silence. The metal began to glow. "...Sigh." Grid stopped. His hand fell away from the bellows. *I can't do this.* Sabotaging the craft wouldn't hurt Euphemina. It would hurt *him*. In the long run, this kind of rot festered. He'd already crawled out of the hole once. Why dig himself back in? He straightened. Cracked his knuckles. Took a breath. *Do it right.* The Abyss Mithril reached optimal temperature. Grid pulled it free and laid it on the anvil, hammer raised. **Ttang! Ttang!** The ornamental housing for the orb began to take shape. His hands moved with surgical precision, shaping the blue-silver metal into delicate filigree. The design was old-fashioned. Baroque. Every curve had to align perfectly or the magic conductivity would drop. Three hours blurred past. Sweat dripped from Grid's chin. The handle was done. Perfect. He set it aside and turned to the magic stones. According to the blueprint, Frost Queen's Breath and Water Clan King's Tears had to be mixed *before* integration. He placed both crystals in a crucible and heated them slowly. They melted. Fused. *What the...* The liquid cooled into a single crystalline mass. Translucent blue. Hard as steel. Not a magic stone anymore. A completely new mineral. *Milepeu created a new element.* Just like Pagma and Braham had forged pavranium from impossibility, the dwarf Milepeu had done the same. Created something that shouldn't exist. Grid's stomach twisted again. *Euphemina gets to keep this mineral too.* First discoverer rights. Exclusive access. Siren was an underwater nation. No one else could even *reach* these materials without her permission. *She's hoarding an entire periodic table.* His hands slowed. The hammer came down crooked. **Kaaang! Kaaang!** The crystal sphere dimpled. Warped. "Heok?" Grid jerked back, staring at the misshapen lump. His jealousy had bled into the metal. *Get it together.* He gritted his teeth. Focused. The修正 strikes came carefully, painstakingly. **Ttang! Ttang!** The sphere smoothed. Rounded. Started to gleam. *This is going to be Epic at minimum.* The realization hit, and with it, another cramp. "Kuoh...!" *Why does she get everything?* The Duplicator class. The Siren Kingdom. And now a legendary orb on top of it all? *Where's MY lucky break?* His next swing came down sloppy. **Kaaang! Kaaang!** *No. Stop. She helped you. She gave you this method.* **Ttang! Ttang!** Delicate corrections. Smooth curves. *But she already has a fraudulent class! She doesn't NEED more advantages!* **Kaaang! Kaaang!** Angry, graceless hammering. *She trusted you to make this. Don't be trash.* **Ttang! Ttang!** *First discoverer benefits are literally unfair. The system is rigged.* **Kaaang! Kaaang!** *You're better than this.* **Ttang! Ttang!** The cycle repeated. Precision. Rage. Precision. Rage. Grid felt like a passenger in his own body, watching his hands war with themselves. One moment, the sphere was flawless. The next, dimpled with fury. Then corrected again. "Hah... what am I even doing?" Dawn light crept through the smithy window. An entire night had passed. The orb was finished. *Clink.* Grid set down the hammer and stared. A blue crystal sphere, perfectly smooth, nested in baroque silver handles. Despite his manic process, the exterior was *pristine*. "...Sigh." He'd lost count of how many times he'd sighed. Had to be over a hundred. But he hadn't stopped. Hadn't walked away. Through the chaos, Grid had finished the job. Then the windows came. > **[The Legendary Blacksmith's Patience skill has been activated. Concentration, stamina and defense will rise to the extremes for one hour.]** > **[The Legendary Blacksmith's Breath has increased the effectiveness of your production items.]** Grid stared at the notifications. He didn't know whether to laugh or cry. The item screen loaded. > **[Indecisive Mumud's Orb]** > > **Durability:** 311/311 > **Magic Damage:** +34% > **Magic Casting Speed:** +23% > **Number of spells that can be stored:** 4 > > * You can permanently store one spell at or below S-grade. > * 15% reduction in skill cooldown time. > * There is a certain chance that magic damage will decrease by 50%. > * There is a certain chance that magic damage will increase by 100%. > * When using possessed magic, there is a certain chance of the effect halving or doubling. > > Among the items made by the great blacksmith 'G,' this is the third piece born with emotions. It has been affected by the indecisiveness of its creator. Due to the emotional ups and downs, it might not work properly or perform better than expected. > > The compatibility with its creator will differ depending on its mood on the day. > > **User Restriction:** Level 280 or higher. More than 3,000 Intelligence. Advanced Orb Mastery Level 5. > **Weight:** 150 > **[A legendary rated item was produced, so all stats have permanently risen by +10 and reputation throughout the continent has risen by +500.]** "...Is this okay?" Grid picked up the orb. Turned it over. The blue crystal caught the dawn light and scattered it in prismatic shards across the walls. The base stats were incredible. Legendary Blacksmith's Craftsmanship boosted performance by **18%**. Legendary Blacksmith's Breath added another **8%**. The orb's magic damage and casting speed were off the charts. But that random variance. *50% decrease.* What if Euphemina cast her strongest spell and it fizzled? What if she stored Meteor and it came out as a firecracker? *How is she going to react to this?* Grid set the orb down gently. Even with a legendary rating, he felt uneasy. He didn't know. Euphemina's Competitor title had unlocked the **Good Luck** stat months ago. Random effects bent in her favor. Always had. Always would. *** "Amazing..." Euphemina cradled the orb like a newborn. Her hands trembled. Tears welled up, spilled over, tracked down her cheeks. The reaction was instant. Primal. The orb Grid produced didn't just meet her expectations. It *shattered* them. And that random modifier? The emotional instability of the creator bleeding into the item? *It's made for me.* Her Competitor title would turn every coin flip into heads. The 50% penalty would never proc. The 100% bonus would fire constantly. "Thank you..." Her voice cracked. The joy was deeper than discovering the Siren Kingdom. Rawer. "I'm really grateful. Encountering you was the best luck I ever had." Euphemina smiled through the tears, nose running, face blotchy. Grid saw her without the mask for the first time. No manipulation. No calculation. Just genuine, overwhelming gratitude. "What... why are you crying?" Grid's jealousy evaporated. Gone like morning dew. *** That day, Grid achieved two milestones. He learned how to forge *practical* legendary items. And he finally broke the "Believe in me" curse. Euphemina became a slave to the power of Overgeared items. Huroi and Lauel welcomed their newest guild member with open arms. --- **Glossary of Common Korean Terms.** **OG:** [Glossary Link] **Current schedule:** 20 chapters a week.
